intro: Grewia dumicola, commonly known as the African wild gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The leaves are simple, ovate, and have a hairy texture, contributing to its adaptability in harsh climates.
